snippet: As “hit lists” of secular writers circulate on the Internet, many writers and journalists have become hesitant to publish work that could attract the attention of Islamists.
abstract: Faisal Arefin Dipan and Ahmed Rahim Tutul, businessmen known for publishing writings of Avijit Roy, Bangladeshi-American known for his critical writings on religious extremism, are fatally stabbed in Dhaka; attack follows stabbing death of Roy in February; rising number of attacks on publishers and writers has made many afraid to speak freely.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Julfikar Ali Manik from Cox’s Bazar, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: As “hit lists” of secular writers circulate on the Internet, many writers and journalists have become hesitant to publish work that could attract the attention of Islamists.

headline.main: 2 Men Who Published Writings Critical of Extremism Are Stabbed in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: 2 Publishers Are Stabbed in Bangladesh as Attacks Rise
